Action.Name: Trace Transaction
Action.Description: Action that will collect transaction traces when an alert threshold is violated.

Action.Name: Send eMail
Action.Description: Email action mapped to all danger alerts in the Default Management Module out-of-the-box. To enable: 1. Configure your mail server using the link below. 2. Check the Active Checkbox. 3. Click Apply.

EmailData.SubjectText: CA APM Alert from ${EM_Host}: ${Alert_Name} in ${Alert_State} state

WidgetProperty.Name: Text
WidgetProperty.TextValue: The Console allows APM data to be organized into custom dashboards. Custom dashboards can be used to:
針對 E.P.I.C. 策略更進一步
针对 E.P.I.C. 策略更进一步

WidgetProperty.Name: Text
WidgetProperty.TextValue: Group APM data into application or role specific views based on your organization.

WidgetProperty.Name: Text
WidgetProperty.TextValue: This custom dashboard example and all default alert configurations are part of the

WidgetProperty.Name: Text
WidgetProperty.TextValue: Overlay APM data onto layouts built using the included pallete of shapes or by importing your own diagrams.

WidgetProperty.Name: Text
WidgetProperty.TextValue: Visualize APM metrics and alerts as simple indicators, graphs, bar charts, or text.

WidgetProperty.Name: Text
WidgetProperty.TextValue: Create triage workflows by linking custom dashboards to other dashboards or external resources.

AlertBase.Name: WebService Client Errors
AlertBase.Description: Alert triggered when the threshold is exceeded for webservice (either SOAP or REST) client-side errors.

AlertBase.Name: Transaction Errors NEW
AlertBase.Description: Alert triggered when the threshold is exceeded for transaction errors.

AlertBase.Name: Backend Response Time
AlertBase.Description: Alert triggered when the threshold is exceeded for non-SQL or non-webservice backend response times.

AlertBase.Name: Frontend Stalls
AlertBase.Description: Alert triggered when the threshold is exceeded for frontend url group stalls. A stall is a frontend request that has not completed within a specified time (30 seconds by default). Stalls indicate a stuck thread, usually due to infinite loop, deadlock, or constrained resources.

AlertBase.Name: WebService Server Errors
AlertBase.Description: Alert triggered when the threshold is exceeded for webservice server-side errors.

AlertBase.Name: Transaction Errors
AlertBase.Description: Alert triggered when the threshold is exceeded for transaction errors.

AlertBase.Name: Servlet Response Time
AlertBase.Description: Alert triggered when the threshold is exceeded for servlet response times.

AlertBase.Name: Response Time Variance Intensity OLD
AlertBase.Description: Alert triggered when the threshold is exceeded for response time variance intensity. Variance intensity is a measure of stability from 10-40. 10 : stable 11 - 20 : relatively stable 20 - 30 : moderately unstable 30 - 40 : severely unstable

AlertBase.Name: CPU Utilization
AlertBase.Description: Alert triggered when the threshold is exceeded for CPU utilization.

AlertBase.Name: Transaction Response Time Variance Intensity
AlertBase.Description: Alert triggered when the threshold is exceeded for response time variance intensity. Variance intensity is a measure of stability from 10-40. 10 : stable 11 - 20 : relatively stable 20 - 30 : moderately unstable 30 - 40 : severely unstable

AlertBase.Name: Servlet Stalls
AlertBase.Description: Alert triggered when the threshold is exceeded for servlet stalls. A stall is a servlet request that has not completed within a specified time (30 seconds by default). Stalls indicate a stuck thread, usually due to infinite loop, deadlock, or constrained resources.

AlertBase.Name: Backend Errors
AlertBase.Description: Alert triggered when the threshold is exceeded for non-SQL or non-webservice backend errors.

AlertBase.Name: SQL Errors
AlertBase.Description: Alert triggered when the threshold is exceeded for SQL errors.

AlertBase.Name: Browser Page Load Complete Time NEW
AlertBase.Description: Alert triggered when the threshold is exceeded for the browser to load all components and the page is complete.

MetricGroupingID.ConstructName: Browser Page Load Complete Time NEW

AlertBase.Name: Servlet Errors
AlertBase.Description: Alert triggered when the threshold is exceeded for servlet errors.

AlertBase.Name: Frontend Errors
AlertBase.Description: Alert triggered when the threshold is exceeded for frontend url group errors.

AlertBase.Name: Frontend Response Time
AlertBase.Description: Alert triggered when the threshold is exceeded for frontend url group response times.

AlertBase.Name: Heap Used Percent
AlertBase.Description: Alert triggered when the threshold is exceeded for the percentage of heap used.

AlertBase.Name: Response Time Variance Intensity
AlertBase.Description: Alert triggered when the threshold is exceeded for response time variance intensity. Variance intensity is a measure of stability from 10-40. 10 : stable 11 - 20 : relatively stable 20 - 30 : moderately unstable 30 - 40 : severely unstable

AlertBase.Name: WebService Client Response Time
AlertBase.Description: Alert triggered when the threshold is exceeded for webservice (either SOAP or REST) client-side response times.

AlertBase.Name: Browser Page Load Complete Time
AlertBase.Description: Alert triggered when the threshold is exceeded for the browser to load all components and the page is complete.

AlertBase.Name: SQL Response Time
AlertBase.Description: Alert triggered when the threshold is exceeded for SQL response times.

AlertBase.Name: WebService Server Response Time
AlertBase.Description: Alert triggered when the threshold is exceeded for webservice server-side response times.

AlertBase.Name: Transaction Response Time NEW
AlertBase.Description: Alert triggered when the threshold is exceeded for transaction response times.

AlertBase.Name: Transaction Response Time
AlertBase.Description: Alert triggered when the threshold is exceeded for transaction response times.
